page.title: 19Personal Mobility:Chinnor et
page.content: Car ownership is almost essential for travel in this area. Public transport consists only of buses, for the railway track through Chinnor now links only the Cement Works with a main line at Princes Risborough. There are bus services to Thame and High Wycombe, and a coach travelling to London passes through the village twice daily. Although important, the local services are too infrequent e.g only two buses either way from High Wycombe to Thame stop in Sydenham on a weekday; there are none on Sundays. Other buses do stop near Sydenham at the crossroads on the Thame Road. School buses take children daily to Icknield School, Watlington, Lord Williams School, Thame, and St Andrews Primary School in Chinnor. Another coach takes students to Henley Tech.
